topic.title: Now Available: Foreign Relations of the United States, 1977–1980, Volume XXIV, South America; Latin America Region
topic.body: This volume is part of a Foreign Relations subseries that documents the most important foreign policy issues of the Jimmy Carter administration. The compilations show high-level U.S. concern over human rights violations in the Southern Cone and policy debates within the U.S. Government over what exactly to do about those violations.
topic.image-description: Book Cover of Foreign Relations of the United States, 1977–1980, Volume XXIV, South America; Latin America Region
topic.image-source-information: Created by the Office of the Historian
